Soal Foto Telanjang di Google Maps, Pakar IT : Seharusnya Google Punya Tim Verifikasi
04 Nov 2019, 13:32 by Munjir Permana


Soal Foto Telanjang di Google Maps, Pakar IT : Seharusnya Google Punya Tim Verifikasi

KBRN, Banda Aceh : Warga net dihebohkan dengan kemunculan pria bertelanjang di layanan google map street view. Foto tersebut muncul jika diketik nama Kota Banda Aceh dan Provinsi Aceh. Foto itu mulai heboh sejak Minggu (3/10/2019) kemarin.
Pada foto tersebut terlihat seorang pria  tampak berswafoto di pinggir pantai dan tidak mengenakan pakaian, dia hanya mengenakan topi. Di tangan pria tersebut tertulis “protest sharia law” atau protes terhadap penerapan syariat Islam.

Baca juga : Viral : Pria Bertelanjang Muncul di Google Map, Protes Hukum Syariah di Aceh

Terkait kemunculan foto tersebut, pakar IT di Aceh juga ikut berkomentar. Seharusnya google selaku perusahaan besar yang sudah mendunia tidak sampai kecolongan yang dapat menimbulkan reaksi kecaman publik.
Direktur Eksekutif Masyarakat Informasi Teknologi (MIT) Aceh, Teuku Farhan mengatakan,  google menerapkan sistem partisipasi pengguna dengan menu kirim masukan.
“Yang disayangkan kenapa bisa lolos ke publik, apakah  tidak ada tim verifikasi dari google?” kata Farhan mempertanyakan, Senin (4/11/2019).

Baca juga : Pemko Banda Aceh Layangkan Protes Terkait Foto Pria Telanjang di Google Map

Menurut Farhan, seharusnya sebagai perusahaan profesional dan bertaraf dunia, google sudah selayaknya memiliki tim verifikasi.
“Jangan sampai google turut menjadi sumber penyebaran hoaks dan rasisme, karena google saat ini telah menjadi sumber referensi awal bagi pengguna internet,” ujarnya.
Dia menambahkan, seharusnya google tidak bisa menyerahkan sepenuhnya kepada pengguna.
“Manusia memiliki rasa, kebijaksanaan. Hal ini yang tidak pernah dimiliki oleh mesin. Google jangan hanya mengandalkan mesin,” ujarnya.
“Google juga harus memberikan reward kepada masyarakat yang melaporkan kelemahan sistemnya, bukan hanya memberikan reward bagi penemu celah yang tidak aman dalam sistem (bug/Vulnerability Reward),” tambahnya.

About Naked Photos on Google Maps, IT Experts: Google Should Have a Verification Team
Nov 04 2019, 13:32 by Munjir Permana


About Naked Photos on Google Maps, IT Experts: Google Should Have a Verification Team

KBRN, Banda Aceh: Net residents are shocked by the appearance of naked men on the Google Map street view service. The photo appears when typed in the name Banda Aceh City and Aceh Province. The photo began to stir since Sunday (10/10/2019) yesterday.
In the photo you can see a man taking a photo on the beach and not wearing clothes, he is only wearing a hat. In the hands of the man written "protest sharia law" or protest against the application of Islamic law.

Also read: Viral: Naked Men Appear on Google Map, Sharia Legal Protest in Aceh

Related to the appearance of the photo, IT experts in Aceh also commented. Google should as a large company that is worldwide not to be cheated which can cause a reaction of public criticism.
The Executive Director of the Aceh Information Technology Society (MIT), Teuku Farhan, said that Google implemented a user participation system with a send feedback menu.
"What is unfortunate is why it has passed to the public, is there no verification team from Google?" Farhan said questioning, Monday (11/04/2019).

Also read: Banda Aceh City Government Protests Related Photos of Naked Men on Google Map

According to Farhan, as a professional and world-class company, Google should have a verification team.
"Don't let Google become a source of spreading hoaks and racism, because Google has now become a source of initial reference for internet users," he said.
He added, Google should not be able to submit fully to the user.
"Humans have taste, wisdom. This is what the machine never had. Google doesn't just rely on machines, "he said.
"Google must also give rewards to people who report weaknesses in their systems, not just give rewards to the inventors of insecure gaps in the system (bug / Vulnerability Reward)," he added.
